column1: Expanded unemployment benefits. Aid for small businesses. Another stimulus check. Relief for state and local governments. Hazard pay for essential workers.  We need all of it—right now.  Let's stop playing politics and finally pass a comprehensive COVID-relief bill.

NEW JERSEY: There's an app that will send you an alert if you've been in contact with a person who's tested positive for COVID-19.  As the pandemic continues this app will help #StopTheSpread and keep our communities safe. Please consider downloading it: https://t.co/MNi2ct6T6k

This pandemic has become the fourth largest mass casualty event in our nation's history.  We're experiencing record numbers of daily COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations.  Please take this seriously. Let's all wear masks practice social distancing and avoid large crowds.

The recent uptick of COVID-19 cases and hospitalizations in our state is deeply concerning. Let's all do our part to keep our communities safe. Please practice social distancing wear a mask and avoid large gatherings.  https://t.co/T5SFBGGOg3

We’ve lost 30 New Jersey first responders to COVID-19.   We can never repay them for their heroism and sacrifice but at very least their families must receive the benefits they deserve.  I was proud to be a leader in the bipartisan effort to get it done. https://t.co/cWEkg2agVl

Members of the Senate Judiciary Committee are currently sick with COVID-19. It is not safe to rush through a Supreme Court nominee and risk further spread of the virus.  These confirmation hearings must be postponed.  https://t.co/uESQe79iXB

Instead of rushing through a Supreme Court nominee Mitch McConnell should hurry up and finally let us pass a COVID-19 relief package.  Countless American families are facing eviction and struggling to put food on the table.  They need our help.

Fortunately we've been able to significantly reduce the spread of COVID-19 here in New Jersey. But we must remain vigilant and keep listening to the experts like Dr. Fauci. Social distancing and mask wearing are still essential. https://t.co/bG1BUeObXa

@LindaNe53652169 @brianschatz Thank you for your concern Linda. I love New Jersey and one of the best things I can do is get Mitch McConnel out of the majority so we can pass a Covid relief package for my state and our nation. Sincerely sending you the best.
The United States continues to far outpace the rest of the world in coronavirus cases.  Donald Trump keeps failing us. https://t.co/HzHnuHN0x1

Powerful message from @PhilMurphyNJ on the impact COVID has had on our state—and it's an honor to stand with him @FirstLadyNJ @NJDSC Chairman John Currie Vice Chair Peg Schaffer and the NJ delegation as we officially nominate @JoeBiden for President!

Since the beginning of this pandemic mitigating the spread of COVID-19 in correctional facilities has been a serious challenge. We're demanding more data from this administration to better understand the scope of infections in our prisons and jails.  https://t.co/8jjT6pF1iS
Hiding your medical experts won't make COVID-19 disappear. #BringBackFauci https://t.co/LwASxxrYKF

We're in need of strong national leadership that the White House has failed to provide. In spite of that I'm fighting to pass additional COVID-19 response legislation in the Senate that will provide New Jersey with economic relief and help health professionals stop the virus. https://t.co/zt0z8u9QZ4

Gun violence was an epidemic before COVID-19 and remains a serious threat to our communities now. As local governments face serious budget deficits we need to make sure there are resources for violence intervention programs that save lives. https://t.co/OA3sBvxJCr

The U.S. has now surpassed 100000 deaths from the coronavirus.  In this period of crisis we cannot trample upon the period of grief. This is a time of pain and hurt for many. Now is when we should be present for each other and focus on healing.
In awe of Sylvia Goldsholl's beautiful spirit and resilience. At the age of 108 she has survived the coronavirus and is on the road to recovery.   https://t.co/dKBPMnxuCQ

The United States makes up less than 5% of the world's population—but because of this president's failed leadership we have nearly a third of the COVID-19 cases on the entire planet right now. https://t.co/yqx4Ia3oMF

We need progress not a return to normal.  I sat down with @EmTSuss for @92Y’s #XYZSummit and #YourPrimaryPlaylist to talk about the #coronavirus pandemic the inequities it exposes in our current system and more. Hear our whole conversation here: https://t.co/Z1jjyQRXcu https://t.co/m5yCQO7Pe8

Our country now has over 1000000 cases of coronavirus. More Americans have lost their lives in just two months of this pandemic than during the entirety of the Vietnam War.  Despair will not have the last word. Together we will get through this.  We shall overcome.

Because of COVID-19 convictions for nonviolent drug offenses are turning into death sentences. We need to quickly move those who pose no safety risk from our jails and prisons to community supervision. Lives depend on it. https://t.co/RqY4aXv0mw
.@GovMurphy has risen to the challenge of the coronavirus pandemic in a major way—providing strong and steady leadership for New Jersey in these uncertain times. https://t.co/0Dhsiww9cd
Please join me on @njdotcom's Facebook Live today at 5:30 p.m. ET. I'm looking forward to answering some of your questions about COVID-19. https://t.co/I00OuGlThC

The legacy of racial inequality—higher poverty rates poor access to health care housing discrimination—has left Black communities particularly vulnerable to COVID-19.  We're not just fighting back against a virus but decades of structural racism. https://t.co/jVjBNwWXcC

.@CISNational is a miracle worker for our children. With the impact that #COVID19 is having on vulnerable students their work is now more important than ever. We need to support organizations like this that are on the front lines of this crisis. #AllinForKids https://t.co/Pf7h8dT3fK

Even during self-isolation @EricLeGrand52 continues to inspire. Remember that there are heroes out there like him for whom contracting #COVID19 could be especially harmful.  Please stay home for Eric and those who are most at risk.  https://t.co/VzAOMaAvdw

There are people being held in jail now who haven't even been convicted of a crime—yet find themselves endangered by the spread of COVID-19 simply because they can't afford to post bail.  It's a matter of life and death that we secure their release.  https://t.co/BVD4fgJQQc

Those in detention centers are at especially high risk for the spread of COVID-19. I'm working with @PramilaJayapal to pass legislation that would require @ICEgov to quickly release immigrants in their custody who pose no safety threat.  https://t.co/U6Q9WJWmqx

For people behind bars contracting #COVID19 can be tantamount to a death sentence. Those incarcerated in our prisons and jails are human beings who deserve to be treated with dignity—but we're failing to take even the most basic precautions to keep them safe. https://t.co/LDjaqwa934

In the midst of darkness light persists. A beloved physician who was diagnosed with #COVID19 has recovered from the virus. Great news for Dr. Pruden and the entire Paterson community. https://t.co/4K5sd3AYJM

We should heed the warnings of these mayors. Black communities are more vulnerable than many others to the harm caused by #COVID19. I've called on @HHSgov to provide demographic data that will help us better understand and act upon the health and economic racial disparities. https://t.co/5njzbxAwb6

New Jersey is at the epicenter of the #COVID19 outbreak and it's going to take significant resources to help us recover.  I've worked hard in the Senate with @BobMenendezNJ these past few weeks to secure this funding that our state so desperately needs. https://t.co/odj0yWHQJh

It's been devastating to hear the stories of those who've lost their lives to this virus. #COVID19 is impacting people of all ages—not just older adults. My prayers are with Ben's family and friends.  Please stay home. https://t.co/6CEvoNY2Bf

Grateful for Josh David & @NJDevils for their incredible support of @RWJBarnabas Health's Emergency Response Fund helping to combat #COVID19. We appreciate all you are doing to help New Jerseyans during this crisis. #JerseyStrong https://t.co/pVZD2n9Jeq

We must protect our most vulnerable from #COVID19 & that includes those in prison with underlying health issues who are susceptible to complications. This is a matter of life & death. We should move these individuals to community supervision—my bill outlines how to do this. https://t.co/AH9akT8m49

If you have any questions about #COVID_19 or need assistance please head on over to @NJGov's information hub. This website is an important resource that can assist New Jersey residents during this public health emergency. #JerseyStrong https://t.co/8Yb6AT32vy

As we move forward with a #COVID_19 relief package the number one concern has to be workers. We should use this moment as an opportunity to reform corporate culture in a way that supports employees—not stock buybacks or higher pay for CEOs. https://t.co/ejwU05mdo1

New Jersey let's follow @GovMurphy's lead. Please stay at home. It's the best way to #FlattenTheCurve and reduce exposure to #COVID_19. These are difficult circumstances for all of us but we'll get through this together. https://t.co/h2IJFwnplp

It couldn't be more imperative that we move quickly to  expand paid sick leave. This is essential not only to stop the spread of coronavirus but for the economic well-being of millions of Americans. https://t.co/xBumAFpGN6

Right now we are in a crisis of leadership. Every day every hour we lose in taking the obvious actions our federal government should be taking—from expanding food stamps to passing paid sick leave—we lose ground and more people risk being infected with #COVID_19. https://t.co/greiMbDkeJ

As the coronavirus spreads American workers need to know that they won't miss a paycheck by staying home if they feel sick. The case for expanding paid sick leave has never been more clear. It's an issue of public health and economic justice.

There are some easy steps we can all take to help stop the coronavirus from spreading further. This is a growing public health threat that should be taken seriously.  Please take the proper precautions and stay informed with the latest updates. https://t.co/cRyyqsr4ko
